name: Creating and editing a tour file

steps.title: Introduction
steps.content: In this tour we will show you how to create a new tour file.

steps.title: Go to settings
steps.content: Click on the settings icon to go to the settings section

steps.title: Create a new file
steps.content: Hover the Tour files tree and click the three small dots to open the context menu.

steps.title: Enter the filename
steps.content: Your Document Type needs a name. Enter extending-media-type in the field and click Next

steps.title: Push the create button
steps.content: Pushe the create button to create your file

steps.title: Open the tour file
steps.content: Click the item in the tree to open the file for editing

steps.title: Adding a tour
steps.content: Click on the add tour button to add a new tour to your file. There can be multiple tours in one file.

steps.title: Enter the tour name
steps.content: You need to name your tour. Enter Adding alt text to image in the field and click Next

steps.title: Alias
steps.content: Each tour needs a unique alias. It's generated for you based on the tour name.

steps.title: Changing the alias
steps.content: While creating a new tour step you have the option to change the generated alias by clicking on the lock item. We will skip this part for now so just click next

steps.title: Enter the groupname
steps.content: The group name is used to group tours in the help drawer. Enter Changing media types in the field

steps.title: Selecting existing groupname
steps.content: If you have existing tours than you can also select a exsiting groupname by clicking on the "Select existing" button

steps.title: Editing the group order
steps.content: You can control the order of the groups in the help drawer by changing this number. For now we leave it to the default. So just click next

steps.title: Section access
steps.content: You need to select the sections the user needs access to, to be able to run this tour

steps.title: Selecting required sections
steps.content: Select settings in the available list

steps.title: Selecting required sections
steps.content: Select settings in the available list

steps.title: Updating required sections
steps.content: Click the submit button to update the selection

steps.title: Allowing disable
steps.content: If you would check this, this adds "Don't show this tour again button" to the intro step. But for now just click next

steps.title: Discard changes
steps.content: You can discard all changes in this tour by clicking the "Discard Changes" button. But we don't want that now so just click next.

steps.title: Update tour changes
steps.content: We want to keep our changes of course so click the "Update tour" button. Keep in mind your changes are not saved yet when clicking this button.

steps.title: Persisting changes
steps.content: Now is a good moment to actually save our changes. So click the "Save" button to save everything to the tour file

steps.title: Removing a tour
steps.content: You can remove a tour from the list by clicking the remove link. But for now just click Next

steps.title: Editing a existing tour
steps.content: For editing a existing tour click on the edit button. Let's do that so we can start adding steps

steps.title: Adding a step
steps.content: Click on the "Add step" button to add a step to tour. Without step the tour will not work

steps.title: Step name
steps.content: We need to give each step a name. This is shown in the header of the step. Fill in Introduction

steps.title: Step content
steps.content: You can add some text to each content in this field. Enter something and click next

steps.title: Make the step a intro step
steps.content:
It's good to have the first step as intro step. So you can tell your users what the tour is about. Click the checkbox to make this a intro step. 

The fields that are not needed for a intro step will be hidden

steps.title: Change the background
steps.content: By changing the backdrop opacity you can control the opacity of the overlay background of the tour step. For now just click Next

steps.title: Discard step changes
steps.content:
You can discard the changes we just made by clicking the "Discard changes" button.

For now just click next because we don't want to do that

steps.title: Update step changes
steps.content: Click the "Update changes" button to update the changes on the tour.

steps.title: Removing a step
steps.content: You can remove a step from the tour by clicking the remove link. But for now just click Next

steps.title: Editing a existing step
steps.content: For editing a existing tour step click on the edit button. But for now just click Next

steps.title: Adding a another step
steps.content: Click on the "Add step" button to add a step to tour.

steps.title: Step name
steps.content: Fill in Navigate to settings

steps.title: Step element
steps.content:
Here you can enter a css selector for the element you wish to be highlighted in the tour step.

For now click next

steps.title: Step element selection
steps.content: You can also select the element from a predefined list based on your sections in the tour

steps.title: Step element selection
steps.content: Select the settings section. You can also find the trees and dashboards on the other tabs/p>

steps.title: Prevent clicking
steps.content: If you want to hightlight a element with out the user to be able to click on it, check this check box. For now just click Next

steps.title: Event
steps.content: Here you can select the javascript event that will trigger the next tour step. Just click next for now

steps.title: Event element
steps.content:
If wish the event to happen on a other element than the highlighted one you can enter the css selector here.

For now just click Next

steps.title: Custom view
steps.content:
You can wire up your own custom view for a tour step. You can specifiy the path here.

If you enter a view path, a extra field will become visible allowing you to enter custom properties that are passed to the view. This needs to be valid JSON

For now just click Next

steps.title: Update step changes
steps.content: Click the "Update changes" button to update the changes on the tour.

steps.title: Update tour changes
steps.content: We want to keep our changes of course so click the "Update tour" button. Keep in mind your changes are not saved yet when clicking this button.

steps.title: Persisting changes
steps.content: Now is a good moment to actually save our changes. So click the "Save" button to save everything to the tour file

steps.title: View your tour
steps.content: We now have created a very basic tour with one step in it. To view it you need to click the Help icon. It's possible you will need to refresh your browser to view the tour
